20110111220116.000|20110111220119.000|TR0|Arizona, three days after a 
20110111220119.000|20110111220121.000|TR0|Congresswoman's meeting with constituents 
20110111220121.000|20110111220123.000|TR0|turned into a bloodbath.
20110111220123.000|20110111220126.000|TR0|
20110111220126.000|20110111220128.000|TR0|Doctors say Representative Gabrielle 
20110111220128.000|20110111220130.000|TR0|Giffords is breathing on her own and is 
20110111220130.000|20110111220133.000|TR0|less sedated.  But she's still in critical 
20110111220133.000|20110111220135.000|TR0|condition, recovering from the bullet that 
20110111220135.000|20110111220137.000|TR0|went through her brain.  Roughly 24 hours 
20110111220137.000|20110111220140.000|TR0|before President Obama attends a memorial 
20110111220140.000|20110111220142.000|TR0|service for the shooting victims, a mass 
20110111220142.000|20110111220144.000|TR0|will be held tonight in memory of the six 
20110111220144.000|20110111220147.000|TR0|people killed and 14 wounded.  Mourners 
20110111220147.000|20110111220149.000|TR0|will gather at the Tucson church where the 
20110111220149.000|20110111220151.000|TR0|youngest victim, 9-year-old Christina 
20110111220151.000|20110111220154.000|TR0|Green, had her first communion.
20110111220154.000|20110111220156.000|TR0|
20110111220156.000|20110111220158.000|TR0|State lawmakers are refusing to let anyone 
20110111220158.000|20110111220201.000|TR0|disrupt the funeral of Green or any other 
20110111220201.000|20110111220203.000|TR0|shooting victim.  They've been working 
20110111220203.000|20110111220205.000|TR0|feverishly to pass legislation to bar 
20110111220205.000|20110111220208.000|TR0|protesters from getting too close to 
20110111220208.000|20110111220210.000|TR0|mourners.  A group known for picketing at 
20110111220210.000|20110111220212.000|TR0|military funerals is promising to show up 
20110111220212.000|20110111220215.000|TR0|in Arizona Thursday when Green is laid to 
20110111220215.000|20110111220217.000|TR0|rest.
20110111220217.000|20110111220219.000|TR0|
20110111220219.000|20110111220222.000|TR0|Jessica Yellin is watching all of this and 
20110111220222.000|20110111220224.000|TR0|more unfold in Tucson -- Jessica, what's 
20110111220224.000|20110111220226.000|TR0|the latest?     JESSICA YELLIN, CNN 
20110111220226.000|20110111220229.000|TR0|NATIONAL POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT:  Wolf, 
20110111220229.000|20110111220231.000|TR0|right now, the Arizona State House and 
20110111220231.000|20110111220233.000|TR0|Senate are meeting to take up this 
20110111220233.000|20110111220236.000|TR0|legislation in what the House speaker told 
20110111220236.000|20110111220238.000|TR0|me is an unprecedented, expedited way.  
20110111220238.000|20110111220240.000|TR0|The legislation would bar any protesters 
20110111220240.000|20110111220243.000|TR0|from within 300 feet of the funeral of 
20110111220243.000|20110111220245.000|TR0|Christina Green, but also of any funeral 
20110111220245.000|20110111220247.000|TR0|here from an hour before to an hour after 
20110111220247.000|20110111220250.000|TR0|the proceedings.
20110111220250.000|20110111220252.000|TR0|
20110111220252.000|20110111220254.000|TR0|As you know, the Westboro Baptist Church 
20110111220254.000|20110111220257.000|TR0|has an anti-gay rights agenda and has used 
20110111220257.000|20110111220259.000|TR0|high profile funerals to get attention.  
20110111220259.000|20110111220301.000|TR0|So the House and Senate are taking up this 
20110111220301.000|20110111220303.000|TR0|measure today.  They say that it's a 
20110111220303.000|20110111220306.000|TR0|measure that usually would take days and 
20110111220306.000|20110111220308.000|TR0|days, if not weeks, to pass.  They've 
20110111220308.000|20110111220310.000|TR0|waived all rules so they can pass it by 
20110111220310.000|20110111220313.000|TR0|the end of business today.  And the 
20110111220313.000|20110111220315.000|TR0|governor has said she would sign it.
20110111220315.000|20110111220317.000|TR0|

20110111221021.000|20110111221024.000|TR0|JEANNE MESERVE, HOMELAND SECURITY 
20110111221024.000|20110111221026.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  Wolf, a law enforcement 
20110111221026.000|20110111221028.000|TR0|source tells us that Jared Loughner took a 
20110111221028.000|20110111221031.000|TR0|knapsack with him to that shooting scene.  
20110111221031.000|20110111221033.000|TR0|We know he had that .9 millimeter Glock. 
20110111221033.000|20110111221035.000|TR0|He had 32 -- two .30 -- .30 round 
20110111221035.000|20110111221038.000|TR0|magazines, two .15 round magazines and a 
20110111221038.000|20110111221040.000|TR0|knife.  This law enforcement official says 
20110111221040.000|20110111221042.000|TR0|they are still looking at this scene.  
20110111221042.000|20110111221045.000|TR0|This source isn't willing to say 
20110111221045.000|20110111221047.000|TR0|definitively yet just how many rounds he 
20110111221047.000|20110111221049.000|TR0|fired there.
20110111221049.000|20110111221052.000|TR0|
20110111221052.000|20110111221054.000|TR0|They are still at that shooting scene.  
20110111221054.000|20110111221056.000|TR0|They're using something called a total 
20110111221056.000|20110111221059.000|TR0|station.  This is a digital piece of 
20110111221059.000|20110111221101.000|TR0|surveying equipment which takes very 
20110111221101.000|20110111221103.000|TR0|precise measurements.  This can be fed 
20110111221103.000|20110111221106.000|TR0|into a computer to give them a recreation 
20110111221106.000|20110111221108.000|TR0|of the crime scene.
20110111221108.000|20110111221110.000|TR0|
20110111221110.000|20110111221113.000|TR0|One instance in which it was previously 
20110111221113.000|20110111221115.000|TR0|used, the collapse of that bridge in 
20110111221115.000|20110111221117.000|TR0|Minneapolis back in August of 2007.  They 
20110111221117.000|20110111221120.000|TR0|used it there to try and figure out 
20110111221120.000|20110111221122.000|TR0|exactly what had happened.  They're using 
20110111221122.000|20110111221124.000|TR0|it for the same purpose here in Tucson.
20110111221124.000|20110111221127.000|TR0|
20110111221127.000|20110111221129.000|TR0|This source tells me that they now have a 
20110111221129.000|20110111221131.000|TR0|pretty good handle -- those are the 
20110111221131.000|20110111221133.000|TR0|source's words -- on Loughner's 22 years.  
20110111221133.000|20110111221136.000|TR0|Obviously, they're particularly interested 
20110111221136.000|20110111221138.000|TR0|in the days and weeks prior to the 
20110111221138.000|20110111221140.000|TR0|shooting.  But law enforcement, at this 
20110111221140.000|20110111221143.000|TR0|point in time, not sharing with us any of 
20110111221143.000|20110111221145.000|TR0|the details.
20110111221145.000|20110111221147.000|TR0|
20110111221147.000|20110111221150.000|TR0|They are still looking for people who knew 
20110111221150.000|20110111221152.000|TR0|Loughner to try and get more.  Still no 
20110111221152.000|20110111221154.000|TR0|indication, this source says, that there 
20110111221154.000|20110111221157.000|TR0|were any other people involved.  No 
20110111221157.000|20110111221159.000|TR0|indication that he had any links to any 
20110111221159.000|20110111221201.000|TR0|groups.  They're still, of course, trying 
20110111221201.000|20110111221204.000|TR0|to come up with a motive for all of this.

20110111221417.000|20110111221419.000|TR0|the wake of Tucson massacre, President

20110111221423.000|20110111221426.000|TR0|a long time ago -- to raise the level of

20110111221435.000|20110111221437.000|TR0|the tragedy presents President Obama the 
20110111221437.000|20110111221440.000|TR0|opportunity to elevate the nasty tone of 
20110111221440.000|20110111221442.000|TR0|politics, much like Bill Clinton did after 
20110111221442.000|20110111221444.000|TR0|the Oklahoma City bombing.

20110111221451.000|20110111221454.000|TR0|country to a higher moral ground.  This 
20110111221454.000|20110111221456.000|TR0|was a promise the president first made in

20110111221458.000|20110111221501.000|TR0|National Convention.  And civil discourse

20110111222209.000|20110111222212.000|TR0|scheduled for next month.
20110111222212.000|20110111222214.000|TR0|
20110111222214.000|20110111222216.000|TR0|The oversight commission appointed by 
20110111222216.000|20110111222219.000|TR0|President Obama to investigate the BP oil 
20110111222219.000|20110111222221.000|TR0|spill is warning that if the government 
20110111222221.000|20110111222223.000|TR0|doesn't take drastic steps, another 
20110111222223.000|20110111222226.000|TR0|disaster could occur.  In a new report,

20110111222228.000|20110111222230.000|TR0|of complacency and blames the three 
20110111222230.000|20110111222233.000|TR0|companies involved in the spill, BP,

20110111222950.000|20110111222953.000|TR0|
20110111222953.000|20110111222955.000|TR0|Let's talk a little more about this, about 
20110111222955.000|20110111222957.000|TR0|Jared Lee Loughner. Joining us now is the 
20110111222957.000|20110111223000.000|TR0|psychologist Alan Lipman, he's the founder 
20110111223000.000|20110111223002.000|TR0|for the Center of the Center For the Study 
20110111223002.000|20110111223004.000|TR0|of Violence here in Washington, also is a 
20110111223004.000|20110111223007.000|TR0|lawyer in addition to being a psychologist.
20110111223007.000|20110111223009.000|TR0|
20110111223009.000|20110111223011.000|TR0|I've heard you say, Alan, that you believe 
20110111223011.000|20110111223014.000|TR0|he's a schizophrenic. Why do you say that? 
20110111223014.000|20110111223016.000|TR0| What does that mean?
20110111223016.000|20110111223018.000|TR0|
20110111223018.000|20110111223021.000|TR0|ALAN LIPMAN, PSYCHOLOGIST:  Well, first of 
20110111223021.000|20110111223023.000|TR0|all, let's get clear that the evidence is 
20110111223023.000|20110111223025.000|TR0|increasingly concrete that this is not 
20110111223025.000|20110111223028.000|TR0|someone who was driven largely by 
20110111223028.000|20110111223030.000|TR0|political motivations.  So let's take it 
20110111223030.000|20110111223032.000|TR0|through a road map of why, with the caveat 
20110111223032.000|20110111223035.000|TR0|that we haven't seen him in the flesh.  
20110111223035.000|20110111223037.000|TR0|There's such ubiquitous evidence that 
20110111223037.000|20110111223039.000|TR0|suggests this is someone with 
20110111223039.000|20110111223042.000|TR0|schizophrenia.
20110111223042.000|20110111223044.000|TR0|
20110111223044.000|20110111223046.000|TR0|Number one, we've looked at these videos, 
20110111223046.000|20110111223049.000|TR0|with the strange and twisted logic --
20110111223049.000|20110111223051.000|TR0|
20110111223051.000|20110111223053.000|TR0|BLITZER:  The YouTube videos?
20110111223053.000|20110111223056.000|TR0|
20110111223056.000|20110111223058.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  The YouTube videos.  And people 
20110111223058.000|20110111223100.000|TR0|have pored over them wondering, does it 
20110111223100.000|20110111223103.000|TR0|show he's on the left or he's the right?  
20110111223103.000|20110111223105.000|TR0|Well, it doesn't show either.
20110111223105.000|20110111223107.000|TR0|
20110111223107.000|20110111223110.000|TR0|What it shows is the incoherence, the 
20110111223110.000|20110111223112.000|TR0|twisted thinking and the neologisms, the 
20110111223112.000|20110111223114.000|TR0|coined words, that are classic signs of 
20110111223114.000|20110111223117.000|TR0|what is called formal thought disorder, 
20110111223117.000|20110111223119.000|TR0|one of the are hallmarks of schizophrenia. 
20110111223119.000|20110111223121.000|TR0|And if you went into an schizophrenic 
20110111223121.000|20110111223123.000|TR0|unit, from when I began at Yale to all the 
20110111223123.000|20110111223126.000|TR0|way to the hospitals here in town, you 
20110111223126.000|20110111223128.000|TR0|would see writing just like this.  That's 
20110111223128.000|20110111223130.000|TR0|number one.
20110111223130.000|20110111223133.000|TR0|
20110111223133.000|20110111223135.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Is that a paranoid 
20110111223135.000|20110111223137.000|TR0|schizophrenic, or is there a difference?
20110111223137.000|20110111223140.000|TR0|
20110111223140.000|20110111223142.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  Well, formal thought disorder is 
20110111223142.000|20110111223144.000|TR0|present in all forms of schizophrenia.  
20110111223144.000|20110111223147.000|TR0|But the next feature which is very clear 
20110111223147.000|20110111223149.000|TR0|is a part of paranoid schizophrenia.  And 
20110111223149.000|20110111223151.000|TR0|it's very important to the shooting that 
20110111223151.000|20110111223154.000|TR0|occurred.  And that is delusions.
20110111223154.000|20110111223156.000|TR0|
20110111223156.000|20110111223158.000|TR0|Delusions are false beliefs that are 
20110111223158.000|20110111223201.000|TR0|bizarre.  If you look at his writings, 
20110111223201.000|20110111223203.000|TR0|which, as we've seen in Secret Service 
20110111223203.000|20110111223205.000|TR0|reports about such shootings, writings are 
20110111223205.000|20110111223208.000|TR0|very valuable indicators of state of mind, 
20110111223208.000|20110111223210.000|TR0|Loughner stated that he believed that his 
20110111223210.000|20110111223212.000|TR0|mind was being controlled. He stated that 
20110111223212.000|20110111223215.000|TR0|he believed that the government was 
20110111223215.000|20110111223217.000|TR0|listening in on him.  Again, textbook 
20110111223217.000|20110111223219.000|TR0|demonstrations of delusions of persecution 
20110111223219.000|20110111223222.000|TR0|--
20110111223222.000|20110111223224.000|TR0|
20110111223224.000|20110111223226.000|TR0|BLITZER:  So these are signs we should be 
20110111223226.000|20110111223229.000|TR0|looking for in individuals like this?
20110111223229.000|20110111223231.000|TR0|
20110111223231.000|20110111223233.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  If you see these writings, they 
20110111223233.000|20110111223236.000|TR0|are clear indicators that this person has 
20110111223236.000|20110111223238.000|TR0|a very high probability of suffering from 
20110111223238.000|20110111223240.000|TR0|a psychotic illness.
20110111223240.000|20110111223243.000|TR0|
20110111223243.000|20110111223245.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Is it also a clear indicator 
20110111223245.000|20110111223247.000|TR0|that this person could become violent?
20110111223247.000|20110111223250.000|TR0|
20110111223250.000|20110111223252.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  Well, let's talk about -- you are 
20110111223252.000|20110111223254.000|TR0|asking the questions that are most 
20110111223254.000|20110111223257.000|TR0|important, because the third indicator, 
20110111223257.000|20110111223259.000|TR0|which is this disruptive behavior that he 
20110111223259.000|20110111223301.000|TR0|showed in the classroom at Pima Community 
20110111223301.000|20110111223304.000|TR0|College, five times they had to call the 
20110111223304.000|20110111223306.000|TR0|campus police, and the behavior was not 
20110111223306.000|20110111223308.000|TR0|this kind of opportunistic antisocial 
20110111223308.000|20110111223311.000|TR0|behavior.  It was strange, bizarre.  So 
20110111223311.000|20110111223313.000|TR0|strange, that his algebra teacher feared 
20110111223313.000|20110111223315.000|TR0|that if he turned his back -- remember, 
20110111223315.000|20110111223318.000|TR0|before the shooting -- that he would 
20110111223318.000|20110111223320.000|TR0|actually be shot by Loughner with an 
20110111223320.000|20110111223322.000|TR0|automatic rifle.
20110111223322.000|20110111223325.000|TR0|
20110111223325.000|20110111223327.000|TR0|This is someone who is having a psychotic 
20110111223327.000|20110111223329.000|TR0|break.  And there was a witness, a friend 
20110111223329.000|20110111223332.000|TR0|of Loughner's, or an acquaintance, who 
20110111223332.000|20110111223334.000|TR0|knew him during the years of 19 to 22, the 
20110111223334.000|20110111223336.000|TR0|age he is now, and said that he underwent 
20110111223336.000|20110111223339.000|TR0|a radical change.
20110111223339.000|20110111223341.000|TR0|
20110111223341.000|20110111223343.000|TR0|BLITZER:  So what makes a schizophrenic, 
20110111223343.000|20110111223346.000|TR0|even a paranoid schizophrenic, become 
20110111223346.000|20110111223348.000|TR0|dangerous?
20110111223348.000|20110111223350.000|TR0|
20110111223350.000|20110111223353.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  It isn't even a paranoid 
20110111223353.000|20110111223355.000|TR0|schizophrenic, but it's especially a 
20110111223355.000|20110111223357.000|TR0|paranoid schizophrenic.  Schizophrenics as 
20110111223357.000|20110111223400.000|TR0|a whole are not dangerous.  A psychopath 
20110111223400.000|20110111223402.000|TR0|would be more dangerous.  But a paranoid 
20110111223402.000|20110111223404.000|TR0|is afraid more than anything else, Wolf, 
20110111223404.000|20110111223407.000|TR0|that someone is out to get them.
20110111223407.000|20110111223409.000|TR0|
20110111223409.000|20110111223411.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Are they hearing things?  Are 
20110111223411.000|20110111223413.000|TR0|people talking to them in their brains?
20110111223413.000|20110111223416.000|TR0|
20110111223416.000|20110111223418.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  Some have hallucinations and some 
20110111223418.000|20110111223420.000|TR0|have delusions.  But the key here and the 
20110111223420.000|20110111223423.000|TR0|connection to Giffords is that if someone 
20110111223423.000|20110111223425.000|TR0|believes that the government is out to get 
20110111223425.000|20110111223427.000|TR0|them in a delusional way, that it's 
20110111223427.000|20110111223430.000|TR0|filling their mind and running through 
20110111223430.000|20110111223432.000|TR0|their mind, and around them is rhetoric 
20110111223432.000|20110111223434.000|TR0|which is hostile and chaotic, research 
20110111223434.000|20110111223437.000|TR0|shows that it makes the symptoms worse, 
20110111223437.000|20110111223439.000|TR0|that because they are paranoid and believe 
20110111223439.000|20110111223441.000|TR0|that people are out to get them, they 
20110111223441.000|20110111223444.000|TR0|believe in the threat, and in that case 
20110111223444.000|20110111223446.000|TR0|they act on it.  And that's what I believe 
20110111223446.000|20110111223448.000|TR0|--
20110111223448.000|20110111223451.000|TR0|
20110111223451.000|20110111223453.000|TR0|(CROSSTALK)
20110111223453.000|20110111223455.000|TR0|
20110111223455.000|20110111223458.000|TR0|BLITZER:  And the tragedy here is that 
20110111223458.000|20110111223500.000|TR0|with the proper medication, these people 
20110111223500.000|20110111223502.000|TR0|can be treated and live relatively normal 
20110111223502.000|20110111223505.000|TR0|lives.
20110111223505.000|20110111223507.000|TR0|
20110111223507.000|20110111223509.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  Well, a very interesting point.  
20110111223509.000|20110111223512.000|TR0|Arizona, unlike many other states, has a 
20110111223512.000|20110111223514.000|TR0|very unique law.  And the law states that 
20110111223514.000|20110111223516.000|TR0|any person, a faculty member, a teacher, 
20110111223516.000|20110111223519.000|TR0|can petition the state to have a 
20110111223519.000|20110111223521.000|TR0|psychiatric evaluation done.
20110111223521.000|20110111223523.000|TR0|
20110111223523.000|20110111223526.000|TR0|No one did this.  If this had been done, 
20110111223526.000|20110111223528.000|TR0|or if a friend, a counselor, a teacher had 
20110111223528.000|20110111223530.000|TR0|taken him --
20110111223530.000|20110111223533.000|TR0|
20110111223533.000|20110111223535.000|TR0|BLITZER:  A parent?
20110111223535.000|20110111223537.000|TR0|
20110111223537.000|20110111223540.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  A parent -- had taken him to a 
20110111223540.000|20110111223542.000|TR0|hospital, there are antipsychotic 
20110111223542.000|20110111223544.000|TR0|medications that would have removed the 
20110111223544.000|20110111223547.000|TR0|very paranoid delusions that you are 
20110111223547.000|20110111223549.000|TR0|talking about, or reduced them, in most 
20110111223549.000|20110111223551.000|TR0|cases. And I tell you now, having seen 
20110111223551.000|20110111223554.000|TR0|this cases for 25 years, if that had 
20110111223554.000|20110111223556.000|TR0|occurred, we would not be talking about 
20110111223556.000|20110111223558.000|TR0|this tragedy today.
20110111223558.000|20110111223601.000|TR0|
20110111223601.000|20110111223603.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Finally, you're a lawyer, too, 
20110111223603.000|20110111223605.000|TR0|in addition to being a psychologist.
20110111223605.000|20110111223608.000|TR0|
20110111223608.000|20110111223610.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  Yes.
20110111223610.000|20110111223612.000|TR0|
20110111223612.000|20110111223615.000|TR0|BLITZER:  If his attorney or he pleads 
20110111223615.000|20110111223617.000|TR0|innocent on the grounds of insanity, does 
20110111223617.000|20110111223619.000|TR0|he have a case?  Is he insane?       
20110111223619.000|20110111223622.000|TR0|LIPMAN:  Look, so that your viewers 
20110111223622.000|20110111223624.000|TR0|understand, there is a difference between 
20110111223624.000|20110111223626.000|TR0|the medical diagnosis of schizophrenia and 
20110111223626.000|20110111223629.000|TR0|the legal standard of insanity.  Insanity 
20110111223629.000|20110111223631.000|TR0|is a legal word, it's a legal standard.  
20110111223631.000|20110111223633.000|TR0|And to boil it down to its essence, it 
20110111223633.000|20110111223636.000|TR0|means, did the person know what they were 
20110111223636.000|20110111223638.000|TR0|doing was wrong, and did they know the 
20110111223638.000|20110111223640.000|TR0|difference between right and wrong?
20110111223640.000|20110111223643.000|TR0|
20110111223643.000|20110111223645.000|TR0|The question is -- and this is something 
20110111223645.000|20110111223647.000|TR0|that you would have to see him to know -- 
20110111223647.000|20110111223650.000|TR0|is, is he so psychotic, if indeed 
20110111223650.000|20110111223652.000|TR0|psychotic -- and the chances are high -- 
20110111223652.000|20110111223654.000|TR0|that he did not know that his actions were 
20110111223654.000|20110111223657.000|TR0|wrong -- and look at his last note that he 
20110111223657.000|20110111223659.000|TR0|left on MySpace.  He told his friends, 
20110111223659.000|20110111223701.000|TR0|"I'm sorry.  Please don't be mad at me."  
20110111223701.000|20110111223703.000|TR0|And that, you can be, sure the prosecution 
20110111223703.000|20110111223706.000|TR0|will use as state of mind evidence that he 
20110111223706.000|20110111223708.000|TR0|knew what he was doing was wrong.
20110111223708.000|20110111223710.000|TR0|
20110111223710.000|20110111223713.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Alan Lipman, thanks very much.  
20110111223713.000|20110111223715.000|TR0|Useful information.
20110111223715.000|20110111223717.000|TR0|

20110111224129.000|20110111224131.000|TR0|he was tackled while trying to reload.

20110111224134.000|20110111224136.000|TR0|high-capacity magazines should not be 
20110111224136.000|20110111224138.000|TR0|legal and are pushing for a ban.
20110111224138.000|20110111224141.000|TR0|
20110111224141.000|20110111224143.000|TR0|SEN. FRANK LAUTENBERG (D), NEW JERSEY:  
20110111224143.000|20110111224145.000|TR0|That enabled him to do the kind of damage 
20110111224145.000|20110111224148.000|TR0|that he did.  So there is no earthly 
20110111224148.000|20110111224150.000|TR0|reason for these weapons to have that kind 
20110111224150.000|20110111224152.000|TR0|of bullet capacity.

20110111224424.000|20110111224426.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
20110111224426.000|20110111224428.000|TR0|

20110111224431.000|20110111224433.000|TR0|tells me that the chances of passing new 
20110111224433.000|20110111224435.000|TR0|gun control legislation, even in the wake 
20110111224435.000|20110111224438.000|TR0|of this tragedy, is "zero."  As one senior 
20110111224438.000|20110111224440.000|TR0|Democratic aide told me, look, this just 
20110111224440.000|20110111224442.000|TR0|is a pro-gun Congress right now.

20110111225401.000|20110111225403.000|TR0|neighbors here, Wolf, really throughout 
20110111225403.000|20110111225406.000|TR0|the day -- the past couple of days, really 
20110111225406.000|20110111225408.000|TR0|-- to get a sense of this neighborhood and 
20110111225408.000|20110111225410.000|TR0|the Loughner family.
20110111225410.000|20110111225413.000|TR0|
20110111225413.000|20110111225415.000|TR0|From the neighborhood, it seems very 
20110111225415.000|20110111225417.000|TR0|friendly, a safe neighborhood.  Everyone 
20110111225417.000|20110111225420.000|TR0|likes everybody.
20110111225420.000|20110111225422.000|TR0|
20110111225422.000|20110111225424.000|TR0|This family is universally described as 
20110111225424.000|20110111225427.000|TR0|being very quiet, that they keep to 
20110111225427.000|20110111225429.000|TR0|themselves.  They have lived here a number 
20110111225429.000|20110111225431.000|TR0|of years.
20110111225431.000|20110111225434.000|TR0|
20110111225434.000|20110111225436.000|TR0|First, Mr. Loughner moved in here when he 
20110111225436.000|20110111225438.000|TR0|was single.  When he got married, his wife 
20110111225438.000|20110111225441.000|TR0|moved in, and they raised their only son, 
20110111225441.000|20110111225443.000|TR0|Jared.
20110111225443.000|20110111225445.000|TR0|
20110111225445.000|20110111225448.000|TR0|And even he had some interaction with some 
20110111225448.000|20110111225450.000|TR0|of the children in the neighborhood and 
20110111225450.000|20110111225452.000|TR0|others who visited the neighborhood, but 
20110111225452.000|20110111225455.000|TR0|as he grew -- he is a person that they 
20110111225455.000|20110111225457.000|TR0|said didn't say much.  And nor was there 
20110111225457.000|20110111225459.000|TR0|much interaction between Mr. and Mrs. 
20110111225459.000|20110111225502.000|TR0|Loughner and the other neighbors.
20110111225502.000|20110111225504.000|TR0|
20110111225504.000|20110111225506.000|TR0|Sometimes we were told that they would 
20110111225506.000|20110111225509.000|TR0|exchange niceties among themselves, but 
20110111225509.000|20110111225511.000|TR0|then one neighbor described how, for some 
20110111225511.000|20110111225513.000|TR0|reason, he stopped talking to her.  And 
20110111225513.000|20110111225516.000|TR0|when the neighbor tried to find out why, 
20110111225516.000|20110111225518.000|TR0|no answer was really given.
20110111225518.000|20110111225520.000|TR0|
20110111225520.000|20110111225523.000|TR0|And another neighbor across the street had 
20110111225523.000|20110111225525.000|TR0|some difficulties with him because of some 
20110111225525.000|20110111225527.000|TR0|trash that was temporarily located that he 
20110111225527.000|20110111225530.000|TR0|hadn't yet gotten rid of, and that was 
20110111225530.000|20110111225532.000|TR0|something that the neighbor said Mr. 
20110111225532.000|20110111225534.000|TR0|Loughner had a hard time letting go of, 
20110111225534.000|20110111225537.000|TR0|even after the trash had been removed.
20110111225537.000|20110111225539.000|TR0|
20110111225539.000|20110111225541.000|TR0|Other than that, I talked to one elderly 
20110111225541.000|20110111225544.000|TR0|neighbor who lives across the street who 
20110111225544.000|20110111225546.000|TR0|said that the last time he saw Jared was 
20110111225546.000|20110111225548.000|TR0|about six, seven weeks ago.  And that is 
20110111225548.000|20110111225551.000|TR0|the first time that he saw him with his 
20110111225551.000|20110111225553.000|TR0|head shaved.  Before that, he said that he 
20110111225553.000|20110111225555.000|TR0|wore his hair in a close-cropped fashion.  
20110111225555.000|20110111225558.000|TR0|And then all of the sudden, inexplicably, 
20110111225558.000|20110111225600.000|TR0|it was shaved.
20110111225600.000|20110111225602.000|TR0|
20110111225602.000|20110111225605.000|TR0|So, not much talk, not much friendly 
20110111225605.000|20110111225607.000|TR0|feelings among the neighbors and the 
20110111225607.000|20110111225609.000|TR0|Loughners.  After this happened, 
20110111225609.000|20110111225612.000|TR0|universally, they said, however, that they 
20110111225612.000|20110111225614.000|TR0|feel very sorry for them, too.
